description:
Section 73 application (minor material amendment) to vary condition 1 (approved plans) of planning permission ref: P110300 dated 17/05/2011 for the: ‘Demolition of existing derelict property (previously a Public House) and erection of a new five storey plus basement building to supply eight x 2-bed flats and a B1 office unit.’ The minor material amendments are:
A] To create a basement level lightwell to the rear elevation of the building.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: No development shall take place until details and samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted, including brick panels with mortar courses and details and samples of any new windows have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

The details submitted to the Local Planning Authority on 24 August 2011 pursuant to condition 3 (facing materials) of planning permission reference  P110300 & P110300(MC1) and approved by the Local Planning Authority on 14 October 2011 are deemed to form the approved details for the purposes of this condition.

REASON: In order to safeguard the existing character and appearance of the surrounding area in accordance with policy 9 of Islington’s Core Strategy 2011 & UDP policies D4, D11.
